meanings.definition: To make (an organization or system) more efficient and effective by employing faster or simpler working methods.
meanings.sent1: The company is streamlining its production process to save time and money.
meanings.sent2: She is streamlining the project by eliminating unnecessary steps.
meanings.sent3: The team's streamlining efforts turned the office into a well-oiled machine.
meanings.sent4: By streamlining the workflow, they were able to meet the deadline ahead of schedule.
meanings.sent5: Streamlining the paperwork made the whole process much smoother.

meanings.definition: To design or construct (an object or system) with a smooth shape to reduce air resistance.
meanings.sent1: The car manufacturer is streamlining the new model for better fuel efficiency.
meanings.sent2: Aerodynamic bicycles are streamlining the way cyclists ride.
meanings.sent3: The streamlining of the airplane made it look like a sleek bird in the sky.
meanings.sent4: The boat's streamlining helped it glide effortlessly through the water.
meanings.sent5: Streamlining the rocket's design improved its speed and performance.
